page.title: 01GENERAL VIEWS OF WOODINGDEAN
page.content: Woodingdean is over the hill from Brighton. From most places you can see the sea, from others the Downs. It is only noisy near the two main roads: most of the area is quiet. There are large cornfields which lead to a park. There is a community centre, a swimming pool, three schools, three churches, and parades of shops. There are two pubs, only one of which you can stay in, as Woodingdean is not really a holiday place. The major land cover is Downland, including a Nature Reserve. There are lots of tracks over the grass some of which are old roadways.
